name: Lal Bhoplyacha Bharit (Red Pumpkin Raita) Recipe
procedure: Chop the pumpkin into cubes and let them boil. Once soft, let the pieces cool and mash them well.
Take a bowl of yoghurt and beat it well. Mix the mashed pumpkin. Add finely chopped green salt and sugar. Mix well.
Preparing the tempering by heating ghee in a tadka pan and adding mustard seeds, curry leaves and asafoetida. Pour the tempering on the raita and mix again. Serve chilled.

name: Chana Masala
procedure: Boil the soaked chickpeas until tender.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add garlic and ginger, sauté until fragrant.
Add tomatoes and cook until they turn soft.
Add turmeric, cumin, coriander, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Add boiled chickpeas and garam masala. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Poha
procedure: Wash the poha and soak it in water for 5 minutes. Drain and keep aside.
In a pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and peanuts. Saute until peanuts are roasted.
Add chopped onions, green chili, and curry leaves. Saute until onions are translucent.
Add mixed vegetables and cook until they are tender. Add turmeric powder and salt.
Add soaked poha and mix well. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Upma
procedure: Dry roast the semolina until it turns golden brown. Keep aside.
In a pan, heat ghee and add mustard seeds, urad dal, and curry leaves.
Add chopped onions, green chili, and ginger. Saute until onions are translucent.
Add mixed vegetables and cook until they are tender.
Add roasted semolina and salt. Mix well and cook until the upma is done.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Idli
procedure: Soak idli rice and urad dal separately for 4-6 hours.
Grind urad dal and fenugreek seeds into a smooth batter. Transfer to a bowl.
Grind idli rice into a slightly coarse batter. Mix with the urad dal batter.
Add salt and mix well. Ferment the batter overnight or until it doubles in volume.
Grease idli molds and pour the batter into each mold.
Steam the idlis for 10-12 minutes or until done. Serve hot with chutney and sambar.

name: Dosa
procedure: Soak dosa rice and urad dal separately for 4-6 hours.
Grind urad dal and fenugreek seeds into a smooth batter. Transfer to a bowl.
Grind dosa rice into a slightly coarse batter. Mix with the urad dal batter.
Add salt and mix well. Ferment the batter overnight or until it doubles in volume.
Heat a griddle and pour a ladle full of batter, spread it in a circular motion to make dosa.
Cook until the dosa turns golden brown. Serve hot with chutney and sambar.

name: Naan
procedure: In a bowl, mix all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, ghee, and salt.
Add yogurt and milk to form a soft dough. Knead well.
Cover the dough and let it rest for 2 hours.
Divide the dough into balls and roll out each ball into a flat oval shape.
Cook the naan on a hot griddle until bubbles appear, then flip and cook until both sides are golden brown.
Brush with butter and serve hot.

name: Roti
procedure: In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour and salt.
Gradually add water and knead to form a soft dough.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll out each ball into a flat circle.
Heat a griddle and cook each roti until brown spots appear on both sides.
Brush with ghee and serve warm.

name: Paratha
ingredients: For stuffing: (choose your favorite - potato, paneer, spinach, etc.)
procedure: In a bowl, mix whole wheat flour and salt. Gradually add water to form a soft dough.
Divide the dough into balls. Roll out each ball into a flat circle.
Place the stuffing of your choice in the center and fold the edges to seal the stuffing.
Roll out again into a paratha shape.
Cook on a hot griddle with ghee until both sides are golden brown.
Serve hot.

name: Puri
procedure: In a bowl, mix whole wheat flour and salt.
Gradually add water to form a soft dough.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll out each ball into a flat circle.
Heat oil in a deep pan. Fry each puri until it puffs up and turns golden brown.
Drain excess oil and serve hot.

name: Missi Roti
procedure: In a bowl, mix gram flour, whole wheat flour, chopped onions, tomatoes, coriander leaves, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt.
Gradually add water to form a soft dough.
Divide the dough into balls. Roll out each ball into a flat circle.
Cook on a hot griddle with ghee until both sides are golden brown.
Serve hot.

name: Paneer Tikka
procedure: In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, gram flour, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt to make the marinade.
Add paneer cubes to the marinade, coat them well, and let it marinate for at least 1 hour.
Thread marinated paneer cubes onto skewers and grill until golden brown on all sides.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Baingan Bharta
procedure: Roast the eggplant on an open flame until the skin is charred and the flesh is soft.
Peel the roasted eggplant, mash the flesh, and set aside.
In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds, chopped onions, and green chilies. Sauté until onions are golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, chopped tomatoes, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the mashed eggplant and cook for a few more minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Malai Kofta
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans), boiled and mashed
1/4 cup cashews, soaked in warm water
procedure: In a bowl, mix grated paneer, mashed vegetables, and soaked cashews.
Shape the mixture into kofta balls and deep fry until golden brown. Set aside.
In a pan, heat oil, add chopped onions, ginger-garlic paste, and sauté until golden brown.
Add tomato puree, garam masala, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the oil separates.
Add fresh cream, chopped cilantro, and the fried koftas. Simmer for a few minutes and serve hot.

name: Dal Makhani
ingredients: 1 cup black lentils (whole urad dal), soaked overnight
procedure: Boil soaked black lentils and kidney beans until soft and cooked.
In a pan, heat butter, add cumin seeds, chopped onions, and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato puree, garam masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the oil separates.
Add the cooked lentils and kidney beans. Simmer for a few minutes, add fresh cream, and garnish with coriander leaves.

name: Aloo Gobi
procedure: In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds, chopped onions, and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add cauliflower florets, diced potatoes, and peas. Mix well.
Cover and cook until the vegetables are tender. Add garam masala and chopped cilantro before serving.

name: Modak
procedure: Heat water with a pinch of salt and a few drops of ghee in a pan.
Add rice flour and stir continuously to form a smooth dough. Let it cool.
In a separate pan, melt jaggery and add grated coconut. Cook until the mixture thickens.
Add cardamom powder to the jaggery-coconut mixture and mix well.
Divide the rice flour dough into small balls and flatten each ball into a disc shape.
Place a spoonful of the jaggery-coconut mixture in the center of each disc and fold to form dumplings (modaks).
Steam the modaks until they are cooked. Serve hot.

name: Gujiya
procedure: Mix all-purpose flour and ghee to form a crumbly texture. Add water and knead into a smooth dough.
In a pan, cook khoya until it thickens. Add powdered sugar, chopped nuts, desiccated coconut, and cardamom powder.
Roll out small portions of the dough into circles. Place the khoya mixture in the center and fold to form a half-moon shape.
Seal the edges with a fork or by pressing with fingers.
Deep fry the gujiyas until golden brown. Drain excess oil and let them cool before serving.

name: Pongal
ingredients: Cashews and curry leaves for tempering
procedure: Wash rice and moong dal together. Cook them in a pressure cooker with water until well-cooked.
In a pan, heat ghee and add cumin seeds, crushed black pepper, asafoetida, cashews, and curry leaves for tempering.
Add the cooked rice and dal mixture to the pan. Mix well and add salt.
Simmer for a few minutes until the flavors blend. Serve hot.

name: Sprouts Salad
procedure: Boil mixed sprouts until they are tender but not mushy. Drain and let them cool.
In a large bowl, combine mixed sprouts, chopped cucumber, tomato, onion, bell peppers, and coriander leaves.
Add lemon juice, chaat masala, salt, and black pepper. Toss everything together.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving. Enjoy the refreshing sprouts salad!

name: Palak (Spinach) Soup
procedure: In a large pot, heat olive oil and sauté chopped onion and minced garlic until fragrant.
Add diced potato and continue to sauté for a few minutes.
Add fresh spinach leaves and sauté until wilted.
Pour in vegetable broth, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until the potatoes are tender.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth. Add milk or cream and season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with croutons if desired. Enjoy the nutrient-rich spinach soup!

name: Quinoa Pulao
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, bell peppers, etc.), chopped
procedure: In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté chopped onion and minced garlic until golden brown.
Add cumin seeds, garam masala, and turmeric powder. Stir well.
Add mixed vegetables and sauté until they are slightly tender.
Add rinsed quinoa and sauté for a couple of minutes.
Pour in vegetable broth or water, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until quinoa is cooked and liquid is absorbed.
Season with salt and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot. Enjoy the nutritious quinoa pulao!

name: Chickpea Salad
procedure: In a large bowl, combine cooked chickpeas, chopped cucumber, tomato, onion, bell peppers, and coriander leaves.
Add lemon juice, cumin powder, chaat masala, salt, and black pepper. Toss everything together.
Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving. Enjoy the refreshing chickpea salad!

name: Vegetable Cutlets
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, potatoes), boiled and mashed
procedure: In a bowl, combine mashed vegetables, breadcrumbs, chopped onions, coriander leaves, cumin powder, garam masala, chaat masala, and salt.
Shape the mixture into patties or cutlets.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the cutlets until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with ketchup or chutney. Enjoy the crispy vegetable cutlets!

name: Cheese Sandwich
ingredients: 1 cup grated cheese (cheddar or your choice)
procedure: Butter one side of each bread slice.
In a bowl, mix grated cheese, black pepper powder, mixed herbs, and salt.
Spread the cheese mixture on the unbuttered side of a bread slice and cover it with another slice, buttered side out.
Grill the sandwich in a sandwich maker or on a griddle until the cheese melts and the bread turns golden brown.
Slice and serve hot. Enjoy the gooey cheese sandwich!

name: Veggie Pasta
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (bell peppers, carrots, peas), diced
procedure: In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté mixed vegetables until slightly tender.
Add cooked pasta, tomato sauce, dried oregano, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Simmer for a few minutes until the pasta is well coated with the sauce.
Sprinkle grated Parmesan cheese and toss until melted.
Serve hot. Enjoy the delicious veggie pasta!

name: Vegetable Biryani
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, beans, potatoes), diced
Whole spices (bay leaf, cardamom, cinnamon, cloves)
procedure: Wash and soak basmati rice in water for 30 minutes. Drain.
In a pan, heat ghee or oil, add whole spices and sliced onions. Sauté until onions are golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and biryani masala. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add mixed vegetables, yogurt, mint leaves, coriander leaves, and salt. Cook for a few minutes.
In a separate pot, cook the soaked basmati rice until 70% done. Drain any excess water.
Layer the partially cooked rice over the vegetable mixture. Garnish with fried onions if desired.
Cover and cook on low heat until the rice is fully cooked and aromatic.
Fluff the biryani gently with a fork and serve hot. Enjoy the flavorful vegetable biryani!

name: Tamarind Rice (Puliyodarai)
procedure: In a pan, heat sesame oil and add mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, asafoetida, and curry leaves. Sauté until mustard seeds splutter.
Add tamarind pulp, turmeric powder, sambar powder, jaggery or sugar, and salt. Cook until the mixture thickens.
Add the cooked rice to the tamarind mixture and mix well until the rice is evenly coated.
Serve hot. Enjoy the tangy and flavorful Puliyodarai!

name: Curd Rice
ingredients: For tempering: 1 tbsp oil, 1/2 tsp mustard seeds, 1/2 tsp urad dal, 1/2 tsp chana dal, 2-3 green chilies, 10-12 curry leaves
procedure: In a bowl, mix cooked rice, plain yogurt, milk, grated cucumber, grated carrot, pomegranate seeds, and chopped coriander leaves.
In a small pan, heat oil for tempering. Add mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, chopped green chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté until dal turns golden brown.
Pour the tempering over the curd rice mixture and mix well. Add salt to taste.
Serve chilled. Enjoy the cool and creamy curd rice!

name: Samosa
procedure: In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Sauté until they splutter.
Add chopped onions and ginger-garlic paste. Cook until onions are golden brown.
Add boiled potatoes, peas, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add fresh coriander leaves and let the mixture cool.
Take the pastry sheets or samosa dough, fill with the potato mixture, and shape into samosas.
Heat oil for deep frying and fry the samosas until golden brown.
Serve hot with chutney. Enjoy the delicious samosas!

name: Bhel Puri
procedure: In a large mixing bowl, combine puffed rice, sev, chopped tomatoes, onions, and cilantro.
Add tamarind chutney, mint-coriander chutney, chaat masala, red chili powder, salt, and chopped green chilies if using. Mix well.
Serve immediately and enjoy the tangy and spicy bhel puri!

name: Dhokla
ingredients: For tempering: Mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies
procedure: In a bowl, mix gram flour, yogurt, ginger-green chili paste, turmeric powder, and salt to form a smooth batter.
Grease a steaming dish and add Eno fruit salt to the batter. Mix well.
Pour the batter into the steaming dish and steam for 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
For tempering, heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Pour the tempering over the steamed dhokla.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and cut into squares. Serve and enjoy the spongy dhokla!

name: Gajar Halwa
procedure: In a heavy-bottomed pan, heat ghee and add grated carrots. Sauté until the carrots are cooked and turn golden brown.
Add whole milk to the carrots and simmer until the milk is absorbed and the mixture thickens.
Add khoya, sugar, chopped nuts, cardamom powder, and saffron strands. Mix well and cook until the halwa reaches a desired consistency.
Garnish with raisins and serve warm. Enjoy the rich and delicious gajar halwa!

name: Sarson Da Saag
procedure: Wash and chop mustard greens and spinach leaves.
Boil the chopped greens in water until tender. Drain and blend into a coarse paste.
In a pan, heat ghee and sauté chopped onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, chopped tomatoes, green chilies, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the green paste and garam masala. Simmer until well combined and cooked.
Serve hot with makki di roti. Enjoy the flavorful sarson da saag!

name: Undhiyu
ingredients: 1 cup surti papdi (broad beans), stringed and halved
1 cup sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
procedure: In a bowl, mix grated coconut, peanuts, sesame seeds, coriander leaves, ginger-green chili paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala to form a masala mix.
In a large pan, heat oil and add surti papdi, baby potatoes, sweet potatoes, brinjals, and fresh tuvar. Mix well.
Add the prepared masala mix and salt. Toss until the vegetables are well coated.
Cover and cook on low heat until the vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot with puris or rotis. Enjoy the flavorful undhiyu!

name: pani puri
procedure: pani puri
